intro.description: In this exercise, you will create the DaoJones bean to access Task documents in the database in an object-relational style.

item.title: Create DaoJones Bean
item.description: Select the "de.ars.taskexample" package and right-click. Select New > Other.... In the dialog window, select DaoJones > DaoJones Bean. Enter "Task" in the class name field and click Finish.

item.title: Map the Task bean to the Task documents in the database
item.description:
Per default, DaoJones maps the name of the class to the type of document in the database. In this case, this would be correct, because tasks in the Notes mail database have the Form="Task" attribute.
To map the Task documents explicitely, add the @DataSource annotation containing the value "Task" to the class.

item.title: Create getters and setters
item.description:
To read and write the document fields, you have to create annotated getters and setters. In the Java editor of the Task class, set your cursor into the class, enter "Dao" and press CTRL+SPACE.
Choose the "DaoJones Getter And Setter" opion and press ENTER. Replace the following template variables. You can switch between the variables by using TAB or SHIFT+TAB (backwards).
- Field: Subject
- column: "Subject"
- type: String
